1.headline: What this project is about
1.paragraph: In this learning project, I test various technologies, which help me build a rather complex webapp prototype. The webapp is based on AngularJS (for now).

2.headline: Basic Ideas of this Webapp Prototype

bullets.1: Develop a multi-tenant environment that enables easy extensibility by appropriately using the available build tools and apply software design patterns in code.
bullets.2: Conveniently use available technologies to ease development of such webapp applications.
bullets.3: Learn from the mistakes in the progress of developing this project and do it better next time.

3.headline: Solutions in this Webapp Prototype
3.paragraph: Though, the content of the webapp itself will not crave your attention, the setup of it will. It uses:

bullets.1: A stable TypeScript modularized project setup,
bullets.2: a TypeScript | Babel compiler pipe to generate browser-independent compatible JS code,
bullets.3: Karma and Jasmine for the unit test environment,
bullets.4: Webpack as a bundler enabling a uniform way building code for the dev, test and production environment,
bullets.5: AngularJS, UI-Router and AngularJS Material as the base of the UI,
bullets.6: a Lerna-based multi-tenant environment that separates each tenant at build time,

images.headline: Test area for importing customizable images
